definitions.definition: To represent by means of a map.
examples: This large atlas maps the whole world in very great detail.
Figure 3 maps the pressure distribution within the human circulatory system.

definitions.definition: To create a map of; to examine or survey in order to gather information for a map.
examples: The team is mapping the route of the new railway line.
The space probe is mapping the Earth's gravitational field.
This equipment is designed to map the neurons of the human brain in three dimensions.

definitions.definition: To have a direct relationship; to correspond .
examples: This doesn't map to my understanding of how things should work.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , followed by a " to " phrase

definitions.definition: To create a direct relationship to; to create a correspondence with.
examples: Map "volume down" to the F2 key.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , followed by a " to " phrase

definitions.definition: To act as a function on something, taking it to something else.
definitions.label_groups: mathematics , transitive , followed by a " to " phrase

definitions.definition: To assign a drive letter to a shared folder .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To represent by means of a map.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To create a map of; to examine or survey in order to gather information for a map.
( intransitive , followed by a " to " phrase ) To have a direct relationship; to correspond .
( transitive , followed by a " to " phrase ) To create a direct relationship to; to create a correspondence with.
( mathematics , transitive , followed by a " to " phrase ) To act as a function on something, taking it to something else.
( transitive , computing ) To assign a drive letter to a shared folder .
